characters: ECU ON JACOB AND BELLA'S FACES
A DIVE BAR, "ONE EYED PETE'S", (SLOW MOTION)
ON THE RUNNING PAIR OF FEET
A SERIES OF DISSOLVES ON BELLA
PUSH IN ON THE PAINTING, THE FOURSOME
ON BELLA AND JACOB FROM A DISTANCE
A SERIES OF TABLEAUS, DISSOLVING INTO ONE ANOTHER
IN THE DISTANCE BY THE CLIFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's surrounded by the dark, lush, greenery of the forest floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "... Which, as they kiss, consume..."            SUDDENLY A FOOT SLAMS DOWN next to the tulip, nearly crushing it. As the foot immediately lifts off again, it grazes the tulip, knocking its petals off --

dialogues.speaker: ON THE RUNNING PAIR OF FEET
dialogues.text: They abruptly change direction. Race on. INCLUDE BELLA SWAN, desperately searching the woods -- SHORT, SURREAL C of her frenetic quest --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward! Ahead, through the darkness of the thick forest, she SEES SUNLIGHT; a clearing. She hurtles toward it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- as Bella bursts into the sunlight. It's the meadow whe Edward revealed his skin in the sun. But he's not here no Instead, Bella SEES -- ACROSS THE MEADOW -- AN OLD WOMAN, white hair framing her withered face. Bella's eyes widen with surprise as she recognizes --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Gran? GRAN looks as surprised as Bella. Bella smiles and waves, as does Gran. Bella starts toward her but --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bella... She spins to the voice behind her to SEE -- EDWARD emerge from the forest, his alabaster skin in shar contrast to the shadows. She beams at him, relieved, in love... until he moves to edge of the shade, inches from sun's rays --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop - she'll see! But Edward just smiles and steps into the sunlight. Sunbeams SHATTER off his skin like a thousand rainbow shards, as if he were made of diamonds. An awesome sight. JUMP CUT TO: Edward now inches from Bella, still glisteni entrancing her. She wraps an arm around his waist, then arranges her face into a calm expression. They turn to -- Gran, whose expression is calm, too. Gran's arm is extended, as if she also holds someone. JUMP CUT TO: Bella and Edward, only feet from Gran now. Bella's about to present Edward, but then SEES that -- Gran mimics Bella's movement exactly. With growing horror Bella reaches out to Gran... and touches glass! PULL BACK TO FIND Gran is now surrounded by a GILDED FRAM It's a MIRROR, mounted on a wall with wallpaper reflectin surreal dreamlike version of the forest behind Bella.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God. -- as she realizes that's not Gran; it's Bella, sixty-fiv years older.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bella spins to her perfect, eternally 17-year-old Edward. He takes her now WRINKLED, age-spotted hand. Kisses it. Then he leans in very close to her 83-YEAR-OLD FACE and whispers into her ear --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy birthday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON BELLA - her eyes snap open. She lies atop her bed. A book, "ROMEO AND JULIET," lays open on her chest. Bella sits up, the dream still weighing on her... INCLUDE HER ROOM, cluttered with pictures of Edward, of t Cullens; memorabilia of all things Edward. A KNOCK on the door. CHIEF CHARLIE SWAN enters carrying two gifts, one wrapped, one not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy birthday, Bells.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, we agreed, no gifts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least mine's not wrapped. He hands it to her. It's a digital camera.   Bella's pleased, despite herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, this is actually kind of great. Thanks, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: wrapped gift)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goes with this one from your mom. We coordinated - well, she coordinated me. Bella opens the wrapped gift to reveal a SCRAPBOOK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To put your pictures in, record your senior year -- man, senior year. How'd you get so old so fast?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not that old.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Is that a wrinkle? Bella races to the mirror, searches her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was kidding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So not funny, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An AERIAL VIEW of this lush, green, overcast landscape; t rainy world that is Forks. FIND Bella's old truck as it lumbers down the two-lane highway...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was just a dream... but also my worst nightmare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bella climbs out of her truck, shouldering her book bag. She looks around the parking lot, seeking Edward --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wherefore art thou, Bella? She turns as MIKE, ERIC, ANGELA and JESSICA approach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You finish the Shakespeare assignment?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He means will you finish his assignment?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't -- okay I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can help you with it -- but first -- (pulling out her camera)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need a picture. My mom's expecting a scrapbook full of memories.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holds up her own camera)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I take `em, I don't pose for `em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pushes Angela to the others; they arrange themselves

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll photoshop my nose if it looks               big, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, I'm in the picture; no one will be looking at you guys. Jessica scoffs, Angela points her camera at Bella; Mike a Eric joust -- Bella aims --

dialogues.speaker: FULL FRAME
dialogues.text: It FREEZES on them, fun, delightfully carefree... but whe the camera lowers, their playfulness has dissipated as th see someone behind Bella. She turns to see -- EDWARD climbing out of his silver Volvo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh good. Cullen's here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (drier)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yay.                                               The friends, uncomfortable, move off --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check ya later. -- But Bella doesn't register their tone. She's transfixe by Edward who approaches, eyes never leaving hers. He reaches her, washing away all her concerns --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy birthday. -- except that one.    Her face falls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't remind me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your birth is definitely a day to                  celebrate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eighteen is a little early to be                   worrying about your age.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's one year older than you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bella, I'm ninety.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: True. Maybe I should be creeped out                that I'm dating such an old guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles, amused)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, it's the age that's creepy, not               the fact that you're dating a vampire.             Then he kisses her, tenderly, adoringly. She kisses him back... despite their restraint, the passion mounts... un he pulls away. As always, both are left wanting more. Edward nods toward the school building --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Class.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.   Class.                                    Catching their breath, they start toward school... but Edward stops, hearing something in his mind. Irritated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone wants you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bella! JACOB BLACK, 16, jogs up, carrying a used car part, long, black ponytail wagging. He looks 18 due to his tall, muscular body, but the gregarious Jacob is a little klutz still catching up to his growth spurt. He nods to Edward, who moves off to the side but eyes them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, Jacob, what are they feeding you on that rez, steroids? You're huge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wouldn't seem so drastic if you came around more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will, soon. But isn't your school, like, ten miles that way?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: car part)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just here buying this for the Rabbit. I'm almost done with the rebuild. Gotta come take a ride when it's done.               (as if remembering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, and hey, happy birthday. Your dad told my dad. So... He pulls from his coat a small woven DREAMCATCHER, feathe dangling from it. He hands it to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw it the other day and thought of you - it catches bad dreams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This, I need. It's great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bell's about to ring. The bell RINGS. Jacob gives Edward an amiable smile, with just a hint of snark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooh, look at you, all psychic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have that particular gift.                   But I can read a watch. I'm clever                   that way.                                            They share a tight smile.   Bella intercedes, squeezing Jacob's arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye, Jake, and thank you. Edward guides her away.   As they walk off --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How come Jacob Black gets to give you a gift and I don't?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's just a friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Friends" don't spend two weeks looking for the perfect dreamcatcher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop reading his mind if he bothers you so much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little hard to tune out. She just laughs, but Edward looks back at Jacob with resentment. Jacob holds his gaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward and Bella enter the double doors -- suddenly a sma wrapped gift appears in Bella's face. ALICE presents it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shh! -- Alice whispers in her ear as she hugs Bella --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- birthday. Over Alice's shoulder, Bella sees JASPER, keeping his distance. He offers her a pleasant nod. She tries to hide Alice's present, hoping no one noticed --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice, didn't I say no gifts?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did. I didn't. I've already seen you open it and guess what? You love it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You had a vision about my birthday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And about the green dress you'll be wearing to your party tonight. Great color on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... My party?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please?     It'll be fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat, confused)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... guess I can deal --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hurriedly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Great! See ya at seven!                          Alice hugs her again and races off before she can change mind. Which is when Bella realizes --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, Jasper, no fair with the mood                 control.                                            He offers an apologetic bow before Alice drags him away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vampires.    You can't trust them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON A T.V. MONITOR - Zeffirelli's `68 "Romeo and Juliet" plays. The suicide scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arms, take your last embrace, and lips, O you, the doors of breath, seal with a righteous kiss...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is dark as we PAN OVER the class, some students entertained, some moved, Mike trying not to fall asleep. The teacher, MR. BERTY, mouths every word --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's to my love! (drinks)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O true apothecary!    Thy drugs are quick. FIND Edward and Bella in the back of the room, desks push together, whisper-talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate being... celebrated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, the last real birthday any of                us had was Emmett's - I think Bing Crosby was on top of the charts. (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll be helping us feel normal for a                night.                                                Bella sits back, knowing she's trapped.    He kisses her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are worse tragedies than a                      birthday. Look at Romeo. He's                         responsible for his wife's death. Who                 could live with that?                                 (looks at the screen)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Though I do envy him one thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (blanches slightly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juliet's alright... if you like that obviously beautiful sort of thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not the girl - the suicide. (off her look)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nearly impossible for my kind. But humans, a little poison, dagger to the heart. There are so many options.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (appalled)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would you even think about that? He turns her wrist over, runs his hand over the horseshoe shaped SCAR on her forearm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I considered it. Once.      When James                had you trapped.                                      FLASHPOP TO "Twilight" - In the ballet studio, JAMES grab Bella's arm and BITES -- BACK ON EDWARD - pained.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know if I'd find you in time. If I'd gotten you killed --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wouldn't have been your fault --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Either way, I had a plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What plan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are... ways for us. At least                  one way. I would have gone to Italy,                provoked the Volturi...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there something you'd like to share              with the class, Edward?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (politely)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Certainly not. But I apologize for                  being a distraction. Perhaps you                    should rewind to act five, scene one,               line twenty-eight eighty-nine --                    (reciting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "If you had the strength of twenty men              it would dispatch you straight."                    Mr. Berty just looks at him, then moves off, intimidated

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eyes on the screen, people.                         Bella is too concerned to be amused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lights glow from inside the beautiful house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Volturi are a very old, very                    powerful family...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON AN 18TH CENTURY OIL PAINTING, depicting Grecian figure swirling robes writhing among pillars and balconies. In a high balcony, FOUR CALM FIGURES look down upon the baccha two black haired, one snowy white, one golden haired...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The closest thing my world has to royalty...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INCLUDE -- Edward and Bella (now wearing a green dress). She studies the painting - the largest on a wall crowded with pictures. The other walls are towering bookshelves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Francesco Solimena painted this; he often depicted the Volturi as Gods. Bella examines the golden haired "God."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that... Carlisle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. He lived with them for a few                    decades. He describes them as very                   refined - for killers.

dialogues.speaker: PUSH IN ON THE PAINTING, THE FOURSOME
dialogues.text: Their features begin to fill in, become real - THEY COME LIFE in the painting, turning to leave the balcony throug an archway. We FOLLOW THEM into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's centuries old, its marble cracked and weathered. The open oculus in the domed ceiling is the only source of light. The room is empty but for three large wooden chair and half a dozen VAMPIRES in elegant 18th century attire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Volturi are also what you might                  call enforcers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only rule they have: to keep                     secret the existence of our kind.                    Two of the Volturi, MARCUS and CAIUS, take their seats, Carlisle stands beside them. ARO moves to the center of t room where we REVEAL -- A ROGUE VAMPIRE is on his knees. He looks feral compared the others, and terrified. Aro puts his hands on either side of the Rogue's face. Compassion?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't make spectacles of ourselves, or kill conspicuously, unless we want                to die. Aro then slowly, dispassionately, RIPS THE ROGUE'S HEAD O Two Volturi Guards (FELIX and DEMETRI) appear on either side, holding him down as Aro easily detaches the head an tosses it aside. Aro calmly sits as the others tear the Rogue limb from limb. Carlisle has to look away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- as Bella spins on Edward --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't even -- talk about that. You                   can't let anyone hurt you. The                       Volturi or anyone else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sees she's worried)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who else would hurt me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said there were more dangerous                   things out there than you. And I know you have at least one enemy --

dialogues.speaker: OFF BELLA'S FACE
dialogues.text: -- ON ALL THREE EVIL VAMPIRES, James, VICTORIA, the dread locked LAURENT (from "Twilight") -- CLOSE ON VICTORIA - fire-red hair, burgundy red eyes, feral, vicious grin (from "Twilight")

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said she'd come after you for killing her mate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victoria? Yes, some day. But Alice                   will see her coming. And she won't win. Bella looks up at him, pained.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate that I can't protect you. He laughs, amused.   She's decidedly not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was me being serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (kissing her face)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. But you do protect me...                     (kisses her nose)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From boredom...                                      (kisses her lips)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And loneliness...                                    (in between kisses)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You give me a reason to stay... un-                  dead. But it's... my job; to protect                 you...                                               -- but he stops, smiles, hearing something in his mind --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... from everyone but my sister. -- as the door bursts open and Alice dances in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's time it's time it's time!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice tugs Bella and Edward to the top of the landing, th skips down the stairs. They look down into -- THE LIVING ROOM - Hundreds of pink candles and rose-fille crystal bowls. ROSALIE, ESME, EMMETT, Carlisle, Jasper an Alice look up at her, all of them stunningly beautiful. Bella would love to disappear, but Edward leads her down THE LIVING ROOM -- where Esme and Carlisle hug Bella warm

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry about all this.   We tried to rein Alice in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like that's even possible.   Happy birthday, Bella. FLASH!   Alice has snapped a picture of Bella with them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: camera)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Found it in your bag.   Mind? Emmett moves to Edward's side.   Nudges him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dating an older woman.    Hot. Bella caught that.    Edward elbows him sharply to shut u

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Rosalie steps up.    Shoves a silver package at Bella.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a necklace. Alice picked it out. She walks away, bored. Bella has to smile.     She sees J across the room. They wave to each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (aims the camera)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show me the love! Edward pulls Bella into an embrace, they look deeply into one another's eyes. FLASH!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For your scrapbook.    Now open your presents! Alice drags Bella over to a table piled with elaborately wrapped gifts, a huge cake and a tall stack of china plat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice, I'm the only one who even eats cake. That thing could feed fifty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hope you're hungry.    Here, this one's from Emmett. The others crowd around... Jasper somewhat away. Bella, n fan of being the center of attention, opens the gift to f an empty car-radio box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um... thanks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Already installed it in your truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally, a decent sound system in that piece of --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No hating on the truck.     Thank you,                Emmett.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open mine. Alice hands her a box.   Bella starts to open it, but --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ouch - paper cut. CLOSE ON BELLA'S FINGER - A single drop of deep red blood appears. Bella thinks little of it, but then HEARS a disturbing, grisly SNARL -- she looks up just as -- BELLA'S POV - JASPER lunges toward her!    Teeth bared, e beyond reason -- -- Edward FLINGS Bella behind his own body, causing her t CRASH into the table, plates shattering as -- -- Jasper SLAMS into Edward; sounds like boulders collidi -- Edward pushes him, hard; Jasper SAILS backward, hittin the wall. But he RICOCHETS off it and comes back at Bella -- Emmett and Carlisle TACKLE Jasper from the side, dragg him to the ground -- Alice helps hold him down --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (soothingly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jaz... shhh -- ... But she stops, her head suddenly jerking toward Bella Then everybody's eyes snap toward Bella as they catch the overwhelming scent -- ON BELLA - lying amid the shards of broken china. She loo at her arm, seeing now - it's been slashed by plate shard bright red blood pulses out of her, pooling. She looks up

dialogues.speaker: THE CULLENS, (SLOW MOTION)
dialogues.text: All of them now, including Edward (but not Carlisle) star down at her, at her blood, with fevered eyes. Six suddenl ravenous vampires... SLOW MOTION ABRUPTLY ENDS as -- Carlisle jumps to Bella's side. Edward, though white as a bone, snaps out of it and stands between her and the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emmett, get Jasper out of here.                      (no response)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emmett. Emmett reins himself in, elbows Rosalie. They drag the snarling Jasper out. Esme holds her nose, politely exits with the others. Alice looks at Bella, apologetic --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I... can't...                             She slips out the door.   Edward's still on guard as Carl examines Bella's arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll have to stitch this up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll carry her to the kitchen. He moves to pick her up, but his eyes dart to the blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take care of her, Edward. (Edward doesn't move)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check on Jasper. Go.                                 Edward looks from him to Bella. Then steps back, allowing Carlisle to lift Bella and carry her to the kitchen. But just before the kitchen door closes, Bella sees Edward's agonized face. He turns away, unable to meet her eyes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bella sits in a chair opposite Carlisle who mops up her blood as he removes glass shards from her arm. He drops o into a bowl; PLINK. She tries not to look at the blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I sure can kill a party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not your fault. Jasper hasn't                   been away from human blood as long as                the rest of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seems like you're the only one it                    doesn't effect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Centuries of practice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you ever think of... living                    differently?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I enjoy   my work too much. Helping                people,   saving lives. I'm hoping                 there's   a point to my existence, even            if I am   damned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damned?    You're not damned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you and I agree. But Edward                   doesn't believe there's an afterlife               for our kind.                                      (looking at her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He thinks we've lost our souls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (realizing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why he won't... He thinks he'd              be damning me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you believed as he did, would you               risk it?                                           Off Bella, no, not ever...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large red bow hangs from the new stereo in the dashboar Edward drives in silence. Bella studies him. Finally --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want me to say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That I'm a klutz. That I should have               been more careful --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a paper cut. Normal people                 get paper cuts. And a normal                       boyfriend wouldn't have flung you into             a stack of plates. A normal boyfriend              wouldn't have had to fight the urge to             kill you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop.   I don't want normal, I want                you.                                               Edward doesn't respond, just pulls the truck into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck stops.   Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't protect me from everything -             something's going to separate us --                accident, illness, old age... as long as I'm human...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (appalled)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's your solution?   My ending your             life?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your giving me forever.                            He faces forward again, jaw tight, mind working, tormente She reaches for his hand --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carlisle told me how you feel, about               my soul, but I don't believe that --               -- he subtly moves his hand away from hers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should go in. It's late.                       He climbs out - instantly he's opening the passenger side door for her. She climbs out. He looks down at her face - he softens as he takes it in. Puts a hand on her cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll leave my window open for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't be coming back.   Not tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then... can I ask for one thing?   It's            still my birthday.                                 (off his nod)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kiss me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lifts her face to his, and kisses her. He begins carefully, gently... but it changes, he becomes urgent, w an almost painful edge, as if it were goodbye. Abruptly, he pulls away. With a last look, he turns walks off into the night. Off Bella...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON A PHOTO - as a printer spits it out. It's the pic Alic took of Bella and Edward's embrace. Bella, troubled, puts it in her scrapbook, her bandaged finger running over it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Romeo and Juliet" lessons are on the board. Everyone's scribbling essays. Bella glances at Edward's desk; empty FLASHPOP TO -- (previous scene in truck) ECU ON EDWARD'S EYES, hard, turning away from her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bella sits with Jessica, Angela, Eric and Mike. They joke throw things. Bella's distracted, looking-out for Edward. FLASHPOP TO -- (scene in the truck) ECU ON EDWARD'S HAND moving away from hers... BACK ON BELLA'S WORRIED FACE, off which we go to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN the photos on the wall. INCLUDE EDWARD who studies them, his expression grim. He looks down at Bella's SCRAPBOOK to SEE the photo of him and Bella. He pulls it out, takes a closer look...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON BELLA THROUGH THE WINDSHIELD of her truck as she pulls into the driveway. She climbs out, heads toward the house but stops, relief washing over her --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward.   You're here. He stands by the house. Bella hurries toward him, but slo when she sees his cold, distant face; an unreadable mask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walk with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward gently takes her hand. Dread fills her, but she le him guide her toward the woods...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward stops by a fallen tree.        Turns to Bella.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to leave Forks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?   Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's time. Carlisle's supposed to be              ten years older than he looks; people will start noticing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But... when?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now.                                              Bella reels, trying to take this in.       Finally --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll have to think of something to                tell Charlie, but I can be ready --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not you.   Us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? -- no -- Edward, what happened              with Jasper - that was nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing compared to what could happen.            You don't belong in my world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I belong with you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- You don't --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I'm coming --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want you to come!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bella is stung, as if slapped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't... want me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.                                                       She steps back.   Trying to understand this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to ask one favor though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks up, hopeful)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do anything stupid or reckless --                   do you understand?                                        (adding)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... for Charlie's sake. Just... take                      care of yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... yes... I will.                                       He softens ever-so-slightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. You're human. Time                           heals all wounds for your kind. Particularly if you're not reminded.                      Desperation wells up in her, overwhelming dignity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, this is - don't do this.     Please.                  He sees she won't let go easily.    Takes a breath. turns cold again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try to understand. Every second with                      you is about restraint. You're too                        fragile. I'm tired of pretending to                       be something I'm not. Reining myself                      in so I can be with a human.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then take my soul. I don't care!        I                 don't want it without you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sharply)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- You're not good for me, Bella.                        Bella looks at him.   His hard face.   His resolve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've let it go on too long.     I'm sorry.                                                   Tears sting Bella's eyes. This can't be happening. He steps forward... kisses her forehead. She closes her eyes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promise, it will be like I never                       existed. Goodbye, Bella.                                 And here, for the first time, we SEE how truly agonizing this really is for Edward. But Bella doesn't see. By the time she opens her eyes - he's gone.    She spins

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Wait -- She SEES a LEAF FLITTERING to the ground where he grazed branch; the only indication of his direction. She hurries down the path, then runs --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward?! -- and she keeps running, going deeper into the woods...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bella runs through the woods, searching, reminiscent of h opening dream. It gets darker and darker, until we're dee night -- HEAR Bella's sharp desperate BREATHS -- BELLA TRIPS. Falls to the damp forest floor.        She l the trees spinning around her...

dialogues.speaker: STAY ON BELLA
dialogues.text: She remains on the ground. Curls into a ball.       Darkn shrouding her. Devastation paralyzing her. ECU ON HER FACE - numb. HEAR the faint sound of her name being called in the distance. A search party. She's too wrecked to respond. Rain begins to pour; she doesn't register it....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SERIES OF SCENES END ON -- BELLA, lying there, dazed. She begins to HEAR an animal SNUFFLING. It gets closer. It sounds large. Scary. Then she hears a whisper --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move, Bella. She lifts her head, looks for Edward... but SEES somethin else instead -- BELLA'S POV - A DARK SHAPE, huge, black. Nearing. Its EYE reflect light for a split second; they're inhuman, savage Bella, terrified, manages to DRAG herself to a cluster of trees. She squeezes between them. Breathing hard. She closes her eyes, trying to disappear...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bella's eyes open to find herself FLOATING several feet above the ground. Trees pass by. She's being carried...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Half the town is gathered - a tired rescue party that includes Mike Newton and Jacob Black. Charlie, beside himself with worry, pores over a map with BILLY BLACK (in wheelchair) and Quileute HARRY CLEARWATER 46, (dark braids, stout, protruding belly, kind face).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll call the Cullens again. Her note said she and Edward went for a walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They left town, Charlie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hospital said Doc Cullen got a big job somewhere else. Harry puts a reassuring hand on Charlie's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll find her, Charlie.                              Charlie is glad for the comfort of his two friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie!                                              Charlie spins to where Jacob points --

dialogues.speaker: THE EDGE OF THE WOODS
dialogues.text: SAM ULEY, 20, emerges, a tall, strong Quileute Indian wit cropped hair and a fierce expression. He's carrying Bella

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Sam Uley. He found her. Charlie bolts to her; he's never moved faster in his life He wraps his arms around Bella, lifting her from Sam's ar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Sam. Thank God. Charlie carries Bella to the house, cradling her. Harry a Billy give Sam a nod of praise and gratitude. But Sam bac away, avoiding any accolades. ON JACOB - jogging alongside Charlie, peering at Bella wi worry. Then Jacob slows, feeling eyes on his back... he turns to SEE Sam Uley staring at him. Jacob, uncomfortabl quickly looks away. ON CHARLIE CARRYING BELLA up the stairs to the house --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What were you thinking, Baby?   Why were you out there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's... gone.                                       Off her as Charlie carries her inside --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OVERHEAD SHOT OF THE BED - Charlie lays Bella down and wr her in blankets...

dialogues.speaker: A SERIES OF DISSOLVES ON BELLA
dialogues.text: She's curled in a fetal position in the middle of the bed Then at its foot. Under the blankets. On top of them. In various different arrangements. Meanwhile... A BLACK LIQUID begins to flood the floor, slowly swallowi everything in the room. It rises up the sides of the bed, higher and higher until it breaches the top of the bed an begins to engulf Bella. Off her, submerged in blackness..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The leaves have turned red and orange.    SEE a FIGURE in upstairs window --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bella sits in a rocking chair by the window. Her face blank. Empty. STAY ON BELLA, unchanging - but THROUGH THE WINDOW OUTSIDE, we SEE TIME LAPSING behind her -- OCTOBER -- Costumed kids appear in the yard, trick-or- treating. DISSOLVE INTO... NOVEMBER -- NEIGHBORS (BOB MARKS and his WIFE) bring Char a turkey... they glance up at Bella's window with concern WINTER BEGINS -- the trees' branches are now bare... DECEMBER -- Charlie drags a Christmas tree toward the hou worry has taken its toll on him. But Bella remains unchanged...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dear Mom... I'm... (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... lost... PAN the now blank walls of the exceedingly neat room; gon are all traces of Edward...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward took everything with him. Including my life. He promised it                   would be like he never existed... ... LAND ON the scrapbook which lies open; the photo of Bella and Edward's embrace at the birthday party - gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BELLA AT HER COMPUTER, typing an e-mail to Renee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... But I need to know he did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bella sits on the couch, blank, as the rain pounds.    Ch watches her, concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like a huge hole has been punched through my chest...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the darkness, Bella is curled up in a ball on her floo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the pain is my only reminder that he was real... that they all were...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lunch. Bella sits alone, staring straight ahead. SEE Jessica, Eric, Angela and Mike, watching her with concern Talking about her. She doesn't notice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I miss them. Especially Alice...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A one-story contemporary home, surrounded by snowy, barre land and woods. Through a LARGE PICTURE WINDOW we SEE Ali and Carlisle, arguing inside --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I'm sure it's better for them, not having me around...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice faces off with Carlisle as the others watch on. Esm desolate; Emmett blank. He sits next to Rosalie who seems almost irritated. Jasper isolates himself in a corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.   We promised Edward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But she won't do well without us. I get            flashes of her, but they're unclear --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget her, let's drag Edward home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll come back when he's ready.                   After Bella moves on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. When she's living her life, safe                 from danger --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with self-contempt)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean safe from us. Alice wraps an arm around Jasper, soothingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointedly to Alice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And when will that be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you see him, Alice?                               They all turn to Alice... a beat. She closes her eyes, trying to get a lock on Edward -- PUSH IN ON ALICE as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only decision he's made...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Visuals are jumpy, unclear) START HIGH ON A MOUNTAINTOP the middle of nowhere. SWOOP DOWN to its peak on which we find EDWARD. Standing still, face agonized.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... is to be alone...                                 -- and suddenly, he starts running, like he's trying to outrun his memories, faster and faster -- he races toward CLIFF; a RAVINE hundreds of feet below -- Edward doesn't slow, just blasts forward faster; then he LEAPS off the cliff, FLOATING, but the pain stays with hi ON EDWARD'S FEET landing hard on the other side of the ravine - as they hit ground we --

dialogues.speaker: BELLA'S FINGERS
dialogues.text: -- as they hit computer keys --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time passes. Every tick that goes by... aches...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INCLUDE BELLA'S COMPUTER SCREEN, as she types...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like the pulse of blood behind a bruise... Bella stops. A beat as she stares at her own words.   The she hits "select all" and "delete" -- ON THE COMPUTER - A BLANK DOCUMENT. She types: "Hi Mom, things are great, grades are up. Hanging with friends. Stop worrying. I'm fine." Bella presses "send", and the cheery e-mail disappears. Bella rises, returns to her rocking chair, staring out desolately. PUSH PAST HER OUTSIDE...

dialogues.speaker: THE WOODS
dialogues.text: -- Someone's watching her, pacing menacingly, hungrily...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bella exits to find Charlie out by the street, stuffing trash into the bins. He talks with neighbor, Bob Marks, w also attends to his trash: two old, beat up motorcycles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's about time you got rid of those, Bob. Seen one too many bikers smeared on the highway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Save the lecture, Chief. Soon as the garbage truck hauls `em off, you and my wife can rest easy. (starts off, but stops)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hey, what's the word on that bear                 problem? Folks are saying they're                     huge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (distracted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's just... talk...                                -- as Charlie watches Bella walk to her truck, head down. Bob sees her, too --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you doin' there, Bella?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bella, in her own world, doesn't respond.   Bob gives Cha an understanding shrug and heads off. ON BELLA as she opens her truck door.   Suddenly, it gets slammed shut again by Charlie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to Jacksonville to live with your mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?   Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just - don't know what to do any                   more. You don't act like someone left                you; more like someone died. She looks away.   That's how it feels to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not leaving Forks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bells, the bastard's not coming back. She nods.   Knows this all too well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not normal, this behavior. And                  frankly, it's scaring the hell outta me, and your mother.                                 (gentler)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go to Jacksonville, Baby. Make some new friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like my old friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never even see them anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do, too. In fact, I'm... um... Jessica and I are going to Port Angeles tomorrow. Shopping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suspicious)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hate shopping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's how good a friend I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (somewhat appeased)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright. Shopping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi Jessica, it's Bella...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bella drives, talking on her cell (hands-free, of course)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Yes, Bella Swan. Hey, any chance you feel like shopping tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bella and Jessica exit the theater.   A MARQUEE behind th bears the title of a ZOMBIE film.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't get why are there so many                   zombie movies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's, like, a metaphor? For crass                   consumerism or something.                           Bella glances at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not that you'd know anything about                  consuming. You didn't buy anything                  today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bought something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Socks don't count. `Course, I was surprised you even called.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been kind of... out of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kind of? I mean, at first I was worried. Then I'm like, okay, she's still bumming? It's not like I wasn't going through things, too. Like Mike deciding he wanted to "just be friends?" That was really hard and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How `bout a ride, girls? As Bella looks ACROSS THE STREET, time suddenly SLOWS --

dialogues.speaker: A DIVE BAR, "ONE EYED PETE'S", (SLOW MOTION)
dialogues.text: -- FOUR ROUGH-LOOKING GUYS loiter out front next to their motorcycles. They're in shadow, we can't see their faces.

dialogues.speaker: OFF BELLA WE SMASH TO --
dialogues.text: FLASHPOPS: Bella surrounded by FOUR GUYS ("Twilight"); Edward's Volvo skidding to a stop; Edward staring them do BACK ON BELLA, a chill going down her spine, FREEZING her she stares at the foursome across the street... Then suddenly -- a pair of lips lean next to her ear --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move, Bella. She turns to find Edward standing next to her. Or so it seems. But he's an illusion; an apparition - which become clear when -- Jessica steps right into him, dissolving him to nothingne

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know them... I think...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we just go -- Jessica pulls at her arm, but Bella shakes her off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to see something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Much to Jessica's frustration, Bella begins to cross the street toward the Guys, frightened but drawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, we got a taker. The apparition of EDWARD REAPPEARS in her path this time. She stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn around, Bella.     This is                        dangerous.                                             But when she steps backward, he fades. Testing her hallucination, she strides forward again -- Edward's apparition reappears, strides alongside her --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop.   Now. She's almost smiling as she reaches the Guys, finally abl to see them clearly -- and stops, realizing --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... You're not them.                                   And with that.... Edward disappears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll be whoever you want, honey. Guy #2 pulls up right next to her on his motorcycle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready for a thrill ride? GUY #2 extends his hand to help her onto the bike.     Sh hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walk away.     Go.                                     Edward's apparition appears on the other side of the bike Bella looks at him with determination -- then climbs on t the back of the bike --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can break promises, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bella! The bike LURCHES forward, going way too fast. As the wind blasts her hair back, she realizes this might have been a mistake --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Wait                                                Guy #2 doesn't hear her, guns the engine, going faster --

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTLY AHEAD
dialogues.text: Edward stands in road, directly in their path, more prese more clear than ever. The bike's headlight illuminates hi racing toward him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop - stop! - STOP!                                    The bike abruptly pulls up short.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I didn't force nothing on you.                     Bella scrambles off, stumbling in the process.    Edward gone. The four Guys then REV their bikes and PEEL out.    Bella watches them go as Jessica storms up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is wrong with you?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost to herself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... saw something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You.   Are insane. Or suicidal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to figure it out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The more dangerous... the more real it                  was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what, you're like an adrenaline junky now? Go hang-gliding or bungie- jumping. Don't be a complete freak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An angry Jessica charges off. Bella watches the motorcycl disappear down the street as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wasn't real. I knew that. I                        didn't care. I needed to see him. If                  danger's what it took, that's what I'd                find.                                                 Off Bella, determination settling into her face...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bella pulls up in her truck, a tarp covering something bi in the back. Jacob comes out of the house. A huge grin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bella! Bella hops out, Jacob gives her a hug.   Bella's surprise his affection, but doesn't mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `Bout time you came by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I brought you something. Bella pulls the tarp back, revealing - her neighbor's two dilapidated, rusting MOTORCYCLES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scrap metal. You shouldn't have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I rescued them from the dump. They'd cost more than they're worth to fix... unless one had a mechanic-type friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me, being the mechanic-type friend? (off her shrug)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since when are you into motorcycles?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Recently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (studying the bikes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The parts alone will be pricey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a college fund I can dig into.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie's gonna love that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie won't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. Lying to Dad. Blowing through                    college money. Repairing dangerous                    machines - that I'm guessing you'll want to ride?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really get it if you think this is stupid and reckless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh it's totally stupid and reckless. (leans closer, grins)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When do we start? Bella face spreads into something we haven't seen in a while... a wide smile. As they pull the bikes off the truck, they laugh and joke; it's as though Jacob has brou Bella back to life. But --

dialogues.speaker: ON BELLA AND JACOB FROM A DISTANCE
dialogues.text: -- someone's watching as the two of them wheel the bikes into the garage. REVERSE on the watcher to discover --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next to Sam stand two others, JARED, 17, and PAUL, 18. Al three have cropped hair, sleeveless shirts, cut-offs. It' unsettling how they watch Bella and Jacob; the ferocity i their eyes, the danger. Sam turns; the others follow his lead. The three slink soundlessly into the darkness of the woods...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two hikers, NATE and TIM, 20's, as they tromp through the shadowy, mist-laden woods. Tim studies his IPhone GPS --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going the wrong way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who cares?   Enjoy the scenery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slapping a mosquito)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the West Nile virus. Tim hears a RUSTLE.    Stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hear that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I knew you were such a wuss, I'd have brought my grandma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could be one of those giant bears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are no giant -- RUSTLE. Nate stops. Then, from the opposite direction, another RUSTLE. Then another, and another, from behind, from in front. It's either more than one creature or it's moving with extraordinary speed. The guys are terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is that?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know! The guys, faced away from one another, search the trees. STAY ON TIM as suddenly, there's an eerie SILENCE. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think it's gone? No answer.   He turns to find that Nate has vanished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nate?   Nate!? Nothing... then the RUSTLING starts again.       And inte Tim BOLTS! CLOSE ON TIM - tearing through the woods, too scared to feel the branches SMACK him in the face. Breath ragged, he looks over his shoulder -- TIM'S POV - BEHIND HIM - something gives chase, flattenin foliage and bending thin trees in its path. Tim runs hard

dialogues.speaker: UP AHEAD THROUGH THE TREES
dialogues.text: A couple cars pass.    Civilization.   Safety.   Tim race

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim bursts from the tree-line, he's almost to the pavemen he`s going to escape -- BAM! Something YANKS him out of frame at an unnatural angle. His SCREAM is abruptly choked off, leaving nothing but a disturbing silence...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Motorcycle parts are spread out on blankets.    Jacob mov among them excitedly, piecing them together.    Bella wat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we're going to be working on this every day, we should probably include some homework. Don't want the Dads to think I'm a bad influence on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You influence me?     Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am older than you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Age ain't nothin' but a number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I convinced you to secretly build us two-wheeled death machines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sudden mock-horror)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, you're right, you're like Satan --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, Jake, you in there? Bella abruptly sits up, starts to pull a tarp over the bi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's cool, it's just my boys. QUIL ATEARA and EMBRY CALL enter, both 16. Quil is short, stocky and feisty, with short hair. Embry is tall, thin a laid back, with chin-length black hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Jake --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stop when they see Bella.        The two guys share

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. This is Bella.         Bella, that's Quil and Embry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So the bike building story is true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taught him everything he knows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the part where you're his                     girlfriend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, we're just friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooh.    Burn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (scrambling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said she's a girl and a friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Embry, you remember him making that distinction?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope. Bella rescues Jacob --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I guess you guys have girlfriends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs loudly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Quil took his cousin to prom. Embry chuckles, as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's still a riot. You want funny, Black? I'll give you funny. Quil makes a run at him, he dodges; a playful scuffle ens Embry, amused, saunters over to Bella.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got five bucks on Quil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're on. The scuffle continues.   Off Bella, enjoying them... A SERIES OF SCENES...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bikes begin to take shape, the parts on the blanket t out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never forgot my reason for doing                   what I was doing...                                  Jacob clowns for Bella's amusement, pretends to skewer himself with a pipe. She laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But being with Jacob was a bigger perk               than I expected...                                   He constantly touches her, playful, affectionate. It's effortless in contrast to Edward's intense restraint. We can see her spirits beginning to lift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bella and Jacob exit, make their way across the yard to h truck. Bella seems lighter, happier than before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quil keeps asking to come over. I                    think he likes you a little too much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell him I'm not into the cougar                     thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it with you and age? I mean,                 that Cullen guy was young, didn't seem               to... bother you.                                    He instantly regrets saying Edward's name as he sees it crush her spirits. Off Bella, retreating into herself...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not even Jacob could keep away the                   nightmares...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bella TEARS through the forest, searching desperately. Th she turns -- finds Edward a few yards away, his face cold She steps toward him -- but he BOLTS backward, suddenly twenty yards away --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... the terror, the loneliness. -- he rapidly retreats further until he disappears, leavi Bella utterly alone, darkness closing in on her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bella SCREAMS in her sleep. The light turns on and Charli hurries to her side, gently shaking her awake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're alright, Bells.   You're okay.             Her eyes open, tears streaming down her cheeks. He doesn' quite know what to do, so hands her a glass of water from her bedside table. She sits up, sips. He pulls the dreamcatcher from her bedpost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This thing's not working very well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's... not as bad as it was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah right.                                       (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what it's like, you know. When             your mom left me. I had a hell of a               time. Imagined doing all kinds of                 crazy things, just to stop the pain.              She avoids his look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But hanging out with Jacob seems to               help get your mind off... things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's been keeping me afloat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's good. He's a good guy.                     Off Bella...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bella drives along the La Push cliffs. Jacob rides shotgu He studies a grease-blackened motorcycle crankshaft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got lucky at the dump. You know how much a new crankshaft goes for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, I spend all my free time on crankshaft-dot-com.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think that's a porn site. (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These bikes are gonna be rolling soon.              Where should we ride first?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someplace sunny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like there's any place sunny around                 here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know a place above the cloud line --              The second she says it, she regrets it -- off her -- FLASHPOP TO - THE MEADOW, Bella lying in the grass with Edward ("Twilight"), flowers surrounding them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is it? BACK ON BELLA - her face falls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, it's... too hard to get to.               He brings his easy smile and optimism to the rescue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So we'll find our sunny spot, right?                She smiles, grateful. Then she looks out the window at th cliffs... and notices --

dialogues.speaker: IN THE DISTANCE BY THE CLIFF
dialogues.text: FOUR MEN stand on the rocky ledge of the cliff (Sam, Jare Paul, and a fourth). They wear nothing but cut-off shorts They push each other, rough-housing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't that... Sam Uley?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bitter)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And his cult. Suddenly, two of the guys throw a struggling Jared over t cliff! BELLA SLAMS on the brakes. Jumps out of the truck Jacob climbs out after her --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God!   Stop them! --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Bella runs toward them.   But Jacob's laughter slows h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're not really fighting, Bella.                 They're cliff diving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, on purpose?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scary as hell, but a total rush. BELLA'S POV - A DIVER (Paul) takes a running start and FLINGS himself into the air, twisting and cartwheeling do Bella is intrigued, sees the potential for adrenaline - f Edward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most of us jump from lower down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think I could?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, first motorcycles, now cliff diving?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said it was a rush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe on a warmer day. And not from the top. We'll leave the showing off to Sam and his disciples. There's that bitter edge again.   She looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't like them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They think they run this place.   Acting all bad ass, calling themselves "protectors."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are they protecting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tribe, the land, their right to be jerks. Embry used to call them hall monitors on steroids; now look at him. Bella looks closer, SEES the fourth guy is Embry, hair no shorn, thin frame filled out, laid back expression gone. pains Jacob to see him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Embry? I didn't recognize him.              What happened to him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He missed some school - then, out of nowhere, he's following Sam around. Same thing happened with Paul and Jared. They weren't even friends, now Sam owns them. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam keeps giving me this look, like                he's waiting for me or something; it's             kinda freaking me out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you should just avoid them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I try but...                                       She sees he's unnerved, instinctively hugs him reassuring

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.   If it gets worse, we'll go to my Dad.   Or you can come stay with us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. (beat, holding her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If this is how you're going to react, I'll freak out more often. Bella realizes she crossed a line and covers, playfully shoving him. As they head to the truck, Bella looks back

dialogues.speaker: ON SAM
dialogues.text: -- but now he's looking directly at her. Then he turns an DIVES over the edge, cutting a clean line into the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bella carries her tray to an empty table, but looks over Mike, Angela, Jessica and Eric. Bella takes a breath, the casually joins them. They take note, but keep talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll kill Tyler if he gave me his flu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's going around. My sister was so sick she couldn't come on our hike this weekend... so she didn't see it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ang, maybe you should keep that to                 yourself --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We saw something, Eric.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No he doesn't. He's just trying to                 get lucky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly hopeful)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that an option?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignoring him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was jet black and huge; on all                  fours it was still taller than a                   person. A bear maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or Big Foot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or an alien. Lucky you didn't get                   probed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... We saw it. She's serious.    And a little scared.   Bella see that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not the only one. Everyone stares.    Did Bella just speak?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My dad's been getting reports at the sheriff's station. A couple hikers went missing. People are scared. Now everyone's chilled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did hear some guy talking about it at the store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last time you clowns doubt my                       girlfriend.                                         As they continue, Angela mouths "thanks" to Bella. They share a smile and join in, Bella becoming part of the gro

dialogues.speaker: ECU ON JACOB AND BELLA'S FACES
dialogues.text: -- just inches apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not. She's lying. PULL BACK to see she's straddling the now completed motorcycle. Jacob stands next to her, holding t bike up. There's an intimacy to their proximity. INCLUDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bike is aimed down a dirt road.     Jacob runs throug instructions:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brake? (she taps it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clutch? (she squeezes it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Gas? (she grips it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ready? Bella nods.   Jacob grins... then KICK-STARTS the bike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slowly... release the clutch. She does... the bike moves forward an inch -- Jacob cautiously steps back. She moves forward another inch --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop. Bella turns to find the apparition of EDWARD standing nex to her. Her hand slips off the clutch, the bike BUCKS and falls on top of her. Jacob quickly lifts it off her as th apparition of Edward disappears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay?   Bruises, breaks -- ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure that's a good -- Bella quickly rises and hops back on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess we're going again. Now what are you going to do with the clutch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Release it.    Slowly. Jacob nods. Then kick-starts the bike again. She releases the clutch and moves forward. Slowly at first -- EDWARD reappears at her side, glowering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She keeps going, a little faster. EDWARD appears on her l now; she passes him. He reappears ahead; she passes. ON BELLA'S FACE as the wind flings her hair back. She gathers speed... and for a moment, experiences pure freed exhilaration... then she sees Edward standing at the curv in the road ahead, and realizes --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling to Jacob)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't -- how do I turn!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bank it!   Bank - hit the brake! Jacob races toward her. She reaches the turn, doesn't ban goes straight... and flies right into a wall of trees. As she lies on the ground dazed, Jacob hurries up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, are you training for the X-games? She looks around for Edward.   He's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to go again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it. I'm revoking your                        motorcycle privileges. Man, look at                 your head.                                          Indeed, blood drips down her forehead. He pulls off his shirt to mop it up. She shrinks away --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're apologizing for bleeding?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't... bother you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just blood, Bella. He bends over her, carefully tending her head. She finds herself looking at him. His dark eyes, his bare chest and smooth skin. He glances at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you staring at?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just, you're actually... good looking.                He's surprised; there's a moment between them.     He smi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How hard did you hit your head?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (realizing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh I - yeah.                                          He offers her a hand, helps her up.    She holds onto it, alarmed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake, you're hot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Upgraded from good looking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, temperature hot.                                  (feels his forehead)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're burning up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel fine.                                          He takes her hand from his forehead.   Holds it.   She tr to pull it away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?   I can't hold your hand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It just... means something else to you                than it does to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One, that's my problem. But two... we                 have fun, you think I'm hot --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good looking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you like me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More than anyone.    But... that's all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because of Cullen?                                    The name stings her.   He takes both her hands now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I know what he did to you. I                    can see it in your face every time his                name comes up. But you need to know -                 I would never, ever do that to you. I                 promise I will never hurt you. You                    can count on me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I already do. You don't know how                      much. You're my best friend but... I                  don't think my feelings will change.                  He takes this in, it's hard. A wave of something sweeps over him. He sits back. Closes his eyes, takes a breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I should've said something                 right from the start --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. That's not -- I just feel...                      weird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you, you have a fever.                         Probably that flu everyone has.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't... feel like flu.    I don't               know what it is.                                      Off Jacob, rattled, and Bella, concerned...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bella does homework. Charlie watches a game.     She's on edge. Anxious. HEAR A BEEEEP --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Jake. Just checking to see how                    you're doing. And to say I'm sorry,                   about, you know... how I feel and...                  hope the flu passes fast. Call me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bella climbs out of her truck, SEES the empty spot where Edward used to park. SEES Eric and Angela canoodling. Couples everywhere. She puts her head down, hurries to class. BEEEEP --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi Jake. Your dad said you have mono.                 He won't let me visit but... would you                call me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bella paces her room, not wanting to sleep/dream.     She the phone, waiting for it to ring. BEEEEP --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me again.   I just... need to hear your               voice...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bella's on the phone, leaving yet another message, her desperation having reached its peak. In the living room, Charlie and Harry check their fishing gear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob.   Please. Call me.                             She hangs up, leans her forehead against the phone.     C enters --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
