dialogues.text: Harry and I will be back by three -- He stops when he sees her.   Puts a hand on her shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's mono, Bells.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's too sick to even call?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just gotta wait it out.                           (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I don't have to go fishing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (forcing a smile)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, go. I'll call Jess or someone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. But stay here or at Jess's. No                 hikes or anything. We're issuing a                   warning about those bears.                           Off Bella's nod --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SERIES OF CUTS - Bella tries to navigate her way to the meadow. She refers to a map, a compass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was more afraid of the hole in my                  chest than I was of bears. Without                   Jacob, I needed Edward more than                     ever...                                              Bella tries a trail; it doesn't look familiar.    Backtra Tries another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I needed to know he existed.                     There was only one place I might find                him, or the feeling of him...                        FLASHPOP - THE MEADOW - Edward and Bella lie in the grass surrounded by flowers, sunlight dappling them. They look lovingly into one another's eyes... BACK ON BELLA - the memory and her desperation fuel her. Finally, she sees a clearing ahead, hurries toward it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Bella steps into the clearing, hopeful... but her face falls. In contrast to the warmth of her memory, the meado is cold, gloomy, cloudy. And no Edward. She closes her eyes, trying to force Edward here. Nothing.   Her eyes open on the empty, overcast meadow. Bella sinks to her knees. Tears threatening. But then she hears a RUSTLING noise. She turns toward it, peers into t woods. Another RUSTLING NOISE comes from another part of the woo She spins toward it -- nothing. Then she turns and JUMPS when she finds -- Vampire LAURENT standing just ten yards away.    Dreadloc chiseled face. Bella can't believe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laurent?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bella.                                             She beams, realizing he's real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laurent!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I must admit, I didn't expect to find you here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I live here. But you - I thought you               were in Alaska with Carlisle's friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanya, I was. It was kind of him to arrange, given my association with James and Victoria, "The Enemy."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You tried to help us.                              Laurent begins to stroll in a slow arc around her, his ey assessing her as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I went to visit the Cullens, but their house is empty. I'm surprised they left you behind. Weren't you sort of a pet of theirs? Bella's smile falters, fear beginning to dawn on her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um... something like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do the Cullens visit often? Suddenly, EDWARD'S apparition appears between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely.    All the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lie better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell them you stopped by. Edward fades (throughout, he'll reappear when he speaks, then fade again). Bella tries to look relaxed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will they be able to reach you in Alaska?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so. Tanya's "vegetarian" family was pleasant enough. But the dietary restrictions were difficult - living on nothing but animals. Suddenly, he's standing inches from her.   She now sees h EYES. Dark blood-red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (conspiratorial)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me Bella. Do you ever feel                         compelled to... cheat?                                  Bella involuntarily takes a step away from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But that's not why I left. I came back here as a favor to Victoria.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... You're still friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More or less. She asked me to get the                   lay of the land with the Cullens. Because, well... I'm afraid Victoria                    is quite put out with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's... too bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. She feels it's only fair to kill Edward's mate, given he killed hers. Eye for an eye, mate for a mate. And now Bella knows.   Terror overwhelms her.   Edward ap

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Threaten him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward will know who did it.   He'll come after both of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think he will. After all, how much could you mean to him if he left you here unprotected? (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victoria sent me here for information.              She won't be happy about my killing                 you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Laurent...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sincere)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, no. Don't be upset. I'm                     doing you a kindness. Victoria plans                on killing you slowly, painfully - whereas I'll make it very quick. (inhaling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you smell so... mouth watering. He faces her, taking in her scent, bloodlust building. eyes dart around, escape is impossible -- The only thing she SEES is the apparition of Edward, look at her with alarm...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering, barely                            audible)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward. I love you.                                 Laurent is milliseconds from biting - then abruptly, his expression changes. He sees something in the forest behin Bella - and it terrifies him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... don't believe it. He steps back. Bella's confused as she realizes he's no longer focused on her... she follows his eyes, slowly turning... to find behind her -- AN ENORMOUS BLACK WOLF skulking out of the darkness of th woods. It stalks towards them, a low disturbing GROWL in its throat, sharp teeth gleaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bella is trapped between the two killers.    Edward whisp in her ear --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't.   Move. The wolf slinks closer to Bella, a mere twenty feet from she stands, then -- FOUR MORE WOLVES soundlessly emerge from the trees, flank the black wolf. They're the size of small horses, all of different hues: dark silver, chocolate, ash and russet- brown. Their hackles are up, lips curling, bodies crouche ready to spring. Bella is frozen with fear as they come toward her. The RU BROWN WOLF is the closest and looks directly at her. Laur continues to retreat - then suddenly, almost simultaneous -- Laurent BOLTS across the meadow -- -- The wolves SPRING toward Bella -- and leap right over in pursuit of Laurent! Their thunderous SNARLS and SNAPS shake her as the pack sprint after the vampire, surroundi him before he reaches the treeline -- Laurent SWINGS at the dark silver wolf, SMACKING the wolf half-way across the meadow. Another wolf lunges at Lauren he kicks it and it sails into a tree, SPLINTERING it. The two wolves recover, lurch back to the pack which clos in on Laurent. It's impossible to know who will prevail - Bella doesn't stay to find out.     She RACES into the wo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Bella runs franticly, tearing down the hillside, tripping, quickly picking herself up -- running, running

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Bella DASHES out of the treeline and to her truck park on the shoulder. She jumps in, PEALS out --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bella BURSTS in, out of breath. Charlie and Harry Clearwater are washing their fishing gear. Charlie spins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bella?   What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're not giant bears -- I saw them. Up in a meadow --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn it, I told you not to go into the woods!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you see, Bella?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wolves.   They're wolves, Dad. We might note, though they don't, that Harry Clearwater sighs ever-so-slightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five of them. The size of - of cars.                 I swear. They went after -- something - - and I ran. Charlie grabs up the phone; as he dials --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry, can you get some men from the rez?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.   Yeah. I'll just -- Harry seems more concerned than gung-ho as he slips out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry? Put a hunting party together -- tranq guns, large caliber shotguns -- there's something dangerous out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something dangerous. Victoria.                       Her eyes dart around the house, their vulnerability spinn in on her. As Charlie hangs up, goes to his gun cabinet -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If she came after me, Charlie would                  try to protect me -- and he'd die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've gotta go to the station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good! -- That's good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay here? You want to come with?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, I -- need to see a friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bella knocks.   Then knocks again.    Finally, Billy answ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Billy.   I know Jacob's sick but --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's out with friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taken aback)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll let him know you came by. Billy starts to close the door, but Bella stops him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait -- he's got mono, right?    That's what you told my dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with compassion)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should go on home, Bella. And he closes the door.      Off Bella --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bella climbs in, slams the door, pissed. Starts the truck Then turns it off. Deciding, she tosses the keys aside an sinks down into her seat to wait...

dialogues.speaker: EXT. JACOB'S HOUSE
dialogues.text: RAIN now pours down. Billy, inside, pulls the curtain bac looks out at Bella with sympathy. Then closes the curtain

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bella looks out the passenger window at Billy. Suddenly, there's a KNOCK at the driver's window. She spins to find JACOB standing there. But his face is shockingly differen His hair is cropped short. No friendly smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No warmth in his eyes. Just a hard, brooding resentment. Bella is taken aback. She climbs out of the truck to FIND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- behind Jacob stand Sam Uley, Jared, Paul and Embry. They're oblivious to the rain, wear minimal clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You cut your hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go away. Jacob turns away. Sam leads the group toward the house. Jacob follows. She, and we, note his sure-footed strides; his awkward growth spurt disappeared overnight. She grabs his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to you? He stops, turns back. The others wait on the porch for hi They're out of earshot, but won't leave him alone with he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lowers her voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can help. His face is hard as he shakes his head.   He's not talkin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam got to you. What did he do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam's trying to help me, don't blame him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bitterness seething)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How `bout those filthy, reeking bloodsuckers you love? The Cullens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thrown)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... don't know what you're --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know exactly what I'm talking                    about.                                               He's shaking, almost convulsing with anger.    She regrou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cullens are long gone.    How are                 they to blame?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They started all this by existing. Goddamn leeches --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob. Jacob glances at Sam, who gives him a look.     Jacob tak breath, trying to calm himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't be friends with you anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake, I know I hurt you. I should have been more up-front but -- I needed you, I still do. I don't know                  what that means yet, but if you give                  me time --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop.    Don't. It's not you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- "It's not you, it's me?"     God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's true.   I'm not... good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're wrong --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't matter.    This is over --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't take losing my best friend, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You already have --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't say that -- you promised --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go home, Bella. Don't come back. He practically runs away, joining the gang who all disapp inside. Off Bella, standing in the rain...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bella enters, dripping wet, too listless to close the doo Charlie's face falls when he sees the pain and lifelessne returned to her. He grabs a blanket, wraps her in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy called, said you and Jacob had a fight. But, hey, you guys will work it out, I'm sure of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm... going to change. Bella heads upstairs.   Charlie sags, helpless.   He move the open door --

dialogues.speaker: EXT. BELLA'S HOUSE, (CONTINUOUS)
dialogues.text: -- It paces, watching Charlie slowly close the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bella TEARS through the forest again, searching. She turn finds Edward, cold, distant. But his face begins to MORPH ... and becomes Jacob's. She reaches for him but he BOLTS backward, suddenly many yards away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why!?                                                He, too, retreats further, disappearing until Bella is al BLACKNESS encroaches, the moonlight becoming a tiny spotlight on her. She searches the dark - then SEES a pai of EYES, female, blood-red - coming toward her; HEAR a lo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Bella tosses herself awake, slowly realizing it was ju a dream. But she HEARS the SCREECHING noise again! Fingernails on her window. Bella bolts upright, looks around for a weapon --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whisper shouting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bella! Ouch - damn it; open the window. Bella cautiously moves to her window to find --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob, shirtless, clings to the top of a tree which bends with his weight. Bella opens the window, whisper-yelling

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of the way. He begins to swing his legs, increasing momentum.       S realizes what he's about to attempt --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! He launches himself THROUGH the window with great agility

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Jacob lands on the balls of his feet. Bella is stunned He freezes, listening for Charlie. Nothing. A bitter, sel satisfied grin spreads on his face. It pisses Bella off. He takes in her room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I pictured your room more...                          cluttered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had to talk to you.   Alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To kick me in the gut again? It was                   bad before, but you made it so much                   worse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. And I want to explain.                        But... I can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then leave.                                           He stays put.   She tries to push him but he's immoveable

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're done with me, remember?   Get.                 Out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bella, I literally can't explain...                  She becomes aware of her hands on his bare skin and muscu chest. The intimacy of their touch. She pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I broke my promise not to hurt you, I                know. But I'm trying to keep it now.                 I need you to understand... even if                  you don't want to see me when you find               out --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find what out?                                       He starts to speak -- but can't.   It's agonizing.   She he's in pain. Is concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, you can. I'll help you. We                      can... we can leave. Leave home,                     leave Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not something I can run away                    from.                                                (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would run with you though. If I                    could.                                               (beat, realizing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. Wait, I already -- I told you.                 You know this -- you can guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to play games with you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to! I can't tell you, but if                you remember - it was that day I ran                 into you at the beach. I told you a                  story -- come on! I told you a                       story... about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... about... "The Cold Ones?" You                    said it was a stupid tribal myth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointedly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was it? Are the Cold Ones a myth?                    She doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What else did I say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That... the tribe made a treaty with                 them. They can't come onto your land                 and... I don't know, I don't remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try, Bella.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to give me more. Tell me                    where to look. Is there something I should see -- ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that's too dangerous --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take the risk.    Jacob, show me.               He looks at her, doesn't want to but knows it's the only way. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where was the last place you saw me...               the way I used to be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The motorcycles - that clearing in the               woods.                                               He nods slowly, then turns to go.    She stops him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't go. There are dangerous things                 out there; more than you know.                       He looks at her with a wry smile. Then pulls her into a hug. Her cheek against his bare chest. She takes in the closeness... then he soundlessly heads out her door. A be -- Bella starts pulling on clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bella drives through the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I was going to lose someone else, I               needed to know why. She pulls off the road, and drives into the forest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bella parks. Climbs out of her truck. The moon eerily illuminates the clearing. Forest NOISES encroach. She hears a RUSTLE amid the trees. Spooked, she freezes - then SEES JACOB emerge from the trees. A moment as their eyes meet. Then -- Sam Uley, Paul, Embry and Jared step into the clearing, a well, half-clothed, movements almost synchronized. Their expressions simultaneously alter into fury when they see Bella. Paul spins on Jacob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell have you done?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't tell her.   You'd know if I                 did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's here, isn't she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bella, there's nothing to see here. You should go home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not until I know what you did to Jacob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (advancing on Bella)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What we did?! Jacob moves in front of Bella protectively, facing Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both of you, calm down --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam, she knows things about the                      bloodsuckers. She's been on the                      inside. She can help --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like a leech lover's gonna help us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch what you call her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get a grip, guys -- But Paul and Jacob are so angry, their bodies begin to shake, nearly convulse. It unnerves Bella --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's alright, Jacob, I'll go --                      Paul and Jacob are beyond hearing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All you care about is her --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (commanding)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul, back off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and she doesn't give a crap about you -- Jacob flashes anger, PUSHES Paul, hard.   Paul FLIES back

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob. Paul rises, outraged, throws his head back in a growl, vibrating violently --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bella, get back!                                     Paul FALLS FORWARD but halfway to the ground there's a lo RIPPING noise and Paul explodes in silver-gray fur, becom a massive wolf crouched and ready to spring! Bella, horrified, grabs Jacob's arm, pulling him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run, Jacob! --                                       But he yanks away from her, runs directly at the Paul-wol

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake, no!   Stop -- !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob DIVES headfirst into the air - with another sharp TEARING sound, shreds of cloth blast into the air, fur BURSTS from Jacob's skin - he lands on the ground a gigan russet-brown wolf, charging the Paul-wolf. Bella reels as the two wolves CRASH into each other, snarling and RAMMING one another. The sound is DEAFENING. Their teeth flash at each other's throats. Bella stumbles backward as the fight carries the two wolv beyond the clearing and into the woods -- CAMERA FOLLOWS THEM, as they fight deeper and deeper into the darkness... until they disappear. The horrible SOUNDS of the fight still ECHO -- BACK IN THE CLEARING -- Sam starts after them, kicking of his shoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take Bella to Emily's place. Sam disappears leaving an eerie quiet.    A long silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess the wolf's out of the bag. Off Bella, stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bella's truck, driven by Embry, pulls up to a tiny, weathered house with a window box full of marigolds. Jare in the back, jumps out, opens Bella's door. He and Embry head toward the house. She doesn't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jared)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pay up. She didn't puke.                                Jared, annoyed, hands Embry five bucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Told you she was tough.     She does run                with bloodsuckers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. We should go back, make sure                      Jacob's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope Paul gets some teeth in him.                     Serve him right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way. Jake's a natural. You see                      him phase on the fly? I gotta fiver                    says Paul doesn't touch him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy money.    Paul's been at it longer.               Bella looks at them, appalled.      They realize she's no following them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on in.    We won't bite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speak for yourself.                                    Bella warily climbs out of the car, joins them.     Embry pauses at the door --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hey, about Emily - Sam's fiance -                  just try not to stare. It bugs Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would I stare? -- -- But the guys are already entering --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bella hesitantly enters behind Jared and Embry. She sees EMILY, 20, at a counter, popping fresh muffins out of a t SEE only one side of Emily's beautiful face, draped by lo black hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys hungry? Like I have to ask... Emily looks toward them now -- REVEALING the other side o her face: A scar runs from hairline to chin, three red li that pull down her eye and twist her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's this?                                            As Jared and Embry beeline for the muffins --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bella Swan.    Who else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're the vampire girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you're a... you're all...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Werewolves? I'm just engaged to one.               But these animals --                               (slaps Embry's hand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Save some for your brothers.                       Bella cautiously approaches the counter, keeping an eye o the door for Jacob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave it to Jacob to get around Sam's gag order.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't say anything, or...                      couldn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a wolf thing. Alpha's orders                get obeyed whether we want to or not --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How `bout you shut up now, Embry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know Jacob's gonna fill her in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know every stupid thought he               has.                                               (to Bella)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanna know what he thinks of you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like you need special powers to know               that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Bella)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's another wolf thing. We hear each              other's thoughts. Good for hunting.                Embarrassing for everything else.                  Jared leans to Bella, challenging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freaking out yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (meets his look)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not the first -- mind reader                I've met.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grins)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake's right. You are good with the                weird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I don't get -- how?   Why? --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Because there are bad things here.              She spins - Sam is now standing behind her, the front doo open behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they're getting worse.                         Bella is chilled. Sam moves past her to Emily - the sight of her instantly warms his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Em. He kisses Emily's scarred face adoringly. Bella has to lo away. Their utter devotion is a painful reminder of what she has lost. Fortunately, she's distracted by -- Jacob and Paul's arrival. They laugh and jab one another. Bella is relieved to find Jacob unscathed. Jared and Embr crowd them, finding a scar on Paul's arm --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha!   Pay up. As Jared reluctantly hands Embry five bucks, Jacob's eyes find Bella's. He nods solemnly to the door; we should tal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun is just beginning to rise, reddening the clouds overhead. Bella paces by the cliff's edge, trying to come to grips with this new reality. Jacob keeps his distance, trying to control his anger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just have to... stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not a life-style choice.   It's in            my DNA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Killing is in your DNA?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, I thought maybe you wouldn't be               such a hypocrite -- what, I'm not the              right kind of monster for you? Can't               measure up to your bloodsucking                    friends --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angry as well)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, they manage to survive without                hurting innocent people.                           Jacob stops -- a beat as his anger is replaced by confusi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait - innocent? -- so... you don't                care that I morph into a giant dog.                Just that I... kill people?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (appalled)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Just?" Those hikers' lives mean that              little to you?                                     He bursts out laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (repelled, turns to go)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bella -- Bella wait...                             (he stops her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not killing hikers.   We're                  trying to protect them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only thing we do kill: Vampires.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned, reels)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vampires? Jake, no --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (steps back, bitter)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, we can't touch your precious Cullens - unless they bite someone and violate the Treaty --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not what I -- you can't fight vampires. They're too dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. We took out that leech with the dreads easy enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You... killed Laurent?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (worried)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... He didn't seem like a friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, God no.    But... how?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's what we do, why we exist. A few              "lucky guys" in the tribe have the                gene. If a bloodsucker moves to town, our DNA kicks in, we reach the right age and the fever hits --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (realizing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Mono."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish. Next thing I know, they're telling me, this is your life now. That future you saw for yourself? Gone. Desolation fills him.   She sees this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's bad, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just hate feeling... out of control. Like maybe Sam is right; you shouldn't            be around me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like you could get rid of me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've seen Emily.                                 That lands with her.   She nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam lost it for a split second; Em was             standing too close -- he's still messed up about it. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to be that kind of nightmare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not like that. You save                     people, right? You saved me from                   Laurent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, didn't mind taking him out. His              red-headed girlfriend will be fun, too. Bella stops, chilled to the bone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victoria.     She's here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We chased her all the way to the border the other night. But she won't stay gone. Keeps coming back -- if we knew what she was after... (sees Bella's face)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what she wants.      Me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MASERATI with Canadian plates blasts down the highway a blinding speed --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON VICTORIA, easily controlling the steering wheel with two fingers. She speaks to someone we don't see, her words laced with longing and fury.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James hated cars. He liked being close to the ground. But I'd steal                    one occasionally, to throw him off the scent... See, we played hide and seek sometimes. No one can hide like me --                 (grins to her passenger)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- but no one could seek like James. INCLUDE her barely conscious passenger, DENISE, 30's, a pretty bleach-blonde with expensive jewelry. She's just coming to, a bump on her head where she was knocked out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What -- what are you -- ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some games   lasted months... but we always got   hungry for each other. (sly,   to Denise)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I'd let   him find me... Denise now lucid, looks around to SEE -- IN THE BACK SEAT her husband, MICHAEL'S BODY, well-dresse in a turtle neck, 40's, sits upright, his head tilted forward as if he's resting. Denise reaches for him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael?    Oh my God --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We never could get enough of each other... (seething)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We would have had forever to try. Denise, scared, shakes Michael's arm --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael?! -- which causes Michael's head to roll to the side, revealing his gouged, blood-soaked neck and his vacant, d eyes. Denise starts SCREAMING. Victoria grins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James always loved a screamer. Victoria's hand jets out, grabbing a fistful of Denise's hair. She yanks Denise over, exposing her neck just as we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excellent. If the redhead's after Bella, we've got bait. With stunning speed, Jacob grabs a four-pronged spading f from some garden tools, and FLINGS it toward Jared's head Jared easily, and amazingly, catches it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is not bait. INCLUDE - A picnic table in the middle of this small, quaintly landscaped garden. Jacob, Bella, Embry, Paul, Sa Jared and Emily are in the midst of a huge breakfast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should leave town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victoria will follow you and make it                 harder for us to catch her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one can catch her.   She can escape               anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooh.   She has special powers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some of them do.                                     They all look at her.   She instantly regrets saying it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like... what? Bella?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mind reader you said you knew. He                was a suckhead? Can they all do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That would blow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I -- shouldn't have - no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's still protecting them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know why. It's not like they                    stuck around to protect you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guys, back off.                                         Jacob looks apologetically at Bella.   She shrinks, stung

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob walks her to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, we've got this place                       covered. She won't get near you or                      Charlie.                                                Bella nods.   He sees she's blue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, we should do something fun.                        Like... cliff diving, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could use the rush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soon.   After we catch her.                             He offers a reassuring look before jogging into the woods

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bella tentatively approaches the large, modern glass home She climbs the porch steps, approaches the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bella enters to find it perfectly intact, lived-in, warm, candles glowing... and the Cullen family enjoying the evening - Carlisle, Esme, Rosalie, Emmett and Jasper. Bella is overwhelmed with joy at seeing them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're here.                                            But they ignore her. Won't even look at her.      She sta toward them but suddenly -- Edward appears and YANKS Bella away, pulling her to the d and pushing her out, slamming it on her --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Bella runs to the window, peers in at the family who continue to ignore her as they gather around Edward --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bella awakens, tears on her face. She can't take it. Gets the hell out of bed, anxious to leave the dream behind. B it stays with her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bella knocks on the door, rain falling around her, wind blowing strong. Emily opens the door. Sees her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bella.   Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I just... is Jacob here?   He                  wasn't at home...                                    Sam appears behind Emily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's with Jared and Embry, keeping an                eye on things. I'm heading out soon.                 Should I tell him something?                         -- as Sam wraps an arm around Emily. Their deep love is achingly obvious. Off Bella's face -- FLASHPOP to Bella and Edward at her birthday party, in a similar embrace, as Alice SNAPS their picture -- BACK ON BELLA - pained.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to come in?                                 -- But Bella's already hurrying to her truck, determinati on her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON A RIFLE as it locks and loads. INCLUDE CHARLIE, who checks it, then notes the position of the SIX MEN in hunting party, all wearing rain gear. He SEES Harry at th end of the line, pausing, looking down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got something, Harry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON HARRY - he looks down at a large WOLF PAW PRINT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope, nothin'. The hunting party moves forward.   Harry lets them get ah stomps out the paw print. ON CHARLIE as he passes under a huge tree -- WHIP PAN UP THE TREE to find that HIGH ABOVE, crouching o limb, is VICTORIA. She watches Charlie with a vengeful gl She noiselessly SWINGS down to a lower branch, getting re to pounce on Charlie -- ON HARRY - his eye catches her movement; he looks up, SEE the back of her red head -- his breath CATCHES -- She HEARS the sound, even through the rain and wind.    B Harry can raise his shotgun -- Victoria's standing next to him, WHIPPING the gun out of hands with superhuman speed. He GASPS, breath stuck in hi chest. She grins, about to bite -- but suddenly -- THE RUSSET-BROWN JACOB-WOLF smashes into her, knocking he away. She rights herself immediately and takes off -- THE THREE WOLVES give chase, disappearing. It all happene soundlessly, in seconds, unbeknownst to the others... STAY ON HARRY - he still can't catch his breath, IN SLOW MOTION he clasps his left arm -- INTERCUT WITH --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LIGHTNING FAST CUTS of THE CHASE - the wolves are right o Victoria's tail, blasting through the forest -- BACK ON CHARLIE - SLOW MOTION - He turns to SEE Harry clutching his chest. Charlie runs to Harry's side -- SMASH BACK TO VICTORIA escaping at breakneck speed she bursts out of the trees to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Victoria beelines for the choppy water, dives in -- wh she reappears, she's hundreds of yards offshore -- THE WOLVES prowl the beach in frustration as we go --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BACK ON HARRY - SLOW MOTION - he falls to his knees just Charlie reaches him. Off Charlie beginning CPR...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bella's truck comes to a stop; she climbs out. Ignoring t wind and rain, she strides to the cliff's edge; looks dow BELLA'S POV - THE WATER - steely gray.     Rough whitecap

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Step back.                                              Bella smiles, tears of relief springing to her eyes.    S turns to find Edward's apparition at her side. She steps back from the cliff's edge - which causes him t disappear. That's it. She starts pulling off her shoes and coat, adrenaline pumping -- Edward's apparition reappears, but she keeps going --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop this now, Bella.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You won't stay with me any other way.                   She takes a last look at him... then with a running leap FLINGS herself over the edge -- ON BELLA SCREAMING with exhilaration as she plummets down down... then SPLASHES into the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No sign of Bella. A beat. Suddenly, she POPS back up. Inhales deeply -- and laughs!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes! She enjoys a moment of elation and empowerment... then tu to swim ashore... but her smile falters when she realizes how strong the current is... A WAVE crashes over her head. She gasps for breath.     T ANOTHER WAVE hits her. Starts to pull her under...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UNDER THE WATER - Bella struggles -- ABOVE WATER - she pops up, looks around in a panic, SEES BELLA'S POV - IN THE DISTANCE - something orange-ish, bobbing on the surface of the water -- Bella goes down - then comes up again - THE ORANGE-ISH th is suddenly thirty yards closer. Bella struggles to stay afloat but the current SMASHES he into a rock, the air goes out of her chest. She sinks. ANGLE ON THE ORANGE-ISH THING -- IT'S VICTORIA, floating effortlessly, hungry anticipation on her face. She dips below the surface, vanishing... UNDER THE WATER - BELLA SINKS, struggling at first... Edw appears in front of her, his eyes full of longing and lov He reaches to her, she to him, hands almost touching, thi going dark... suddenly A HAND GRABS HER COLLAR --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON BELLA - barely conscious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breathe, Bella! C'mon! Jacob hits her on the back.   She spits up water, coming

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bella?   Can you hear me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Jake? She focuses, finally SEES Jacob hovering over her, reliev Behind him stands Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She'll be alright. Sam looks out at the water, scanning it.   Sensing someth

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell were you thinking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I needed... to see... something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? The pearly gates?   If we hadn't heard you scream --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get her home. I'm heading to the                  hospital. I'll meet you there.                    Jacob nods.   Sam jogs off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would you jump? Didn't you notice it's like a hurricane out here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. It was stupid --                          (realizing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Sam said hospital - someone's hurt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry Clearwater had a heart attack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God - does my Dad know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He and my dad are both over there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will Harry be okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Come on. I'll find you something dry and drive you home. As Jacob helps Bella up, we RACK FOCUS out to -- ANGLE ON THE WATER - where Victoria bobs, watching Jacob guide Bella away... then she disappears below the surface

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob drives. Bella wears a fleece jacket but still shivers. He pulls her close, wrapping an arm around her -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hundred and eight degrees over here. She tucks herself into him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must be nice, never getting cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a wolf thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a Jacob thing.   You're just...              warm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grins)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like the sun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (meaning it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like the sun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which always comes back.   You can                count on me.                                      She nods.   Awkward silence.   He fills it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are other cool things about all             this, like -- I heal fast. Wanna see              me stab my hand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (no!)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, `cause that would be fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck pulls up to the curb. It's pitch black outside. Jacob's still holding her close as he shuts the engine of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So... this wolf thing's not all bad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's better. Now that you know.                   But...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It just... comes so easily to me.                 More than the other guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a good thing, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe. Or maybe it makes me less...                 human than the others. (beat, quieter)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes I'm scared I might...                     disappear, you know? Who I really am.               Bella faces him, looks directly in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't let that happen. Their faces are close... and stay close for an intimate beat. They could kiss, their lips near... but Bella blink herself back to reality and pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for driving - for everything. -- as she pushes open her door. WIND wafts in -- Jacob reacts to a repugnant smell outside --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy crap -- ! He abruptly pulls Bella back into the truck, SLAMS her do shut and starts the truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a bloodsucker out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can smell the stink.   I'm getting                you out of here. As Jacob whips the truck around, the HEADLIGHTS ILLUMINAT BELLA'S POV - THE DRIVEWAY -- a black Mercedes is parked front. Bella spins to the rear window as Jacob floors it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop!   It's not Victoria --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Carlisle's car!   They're here.                Go back! --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a trick -- He's still flooring it -- Bella cracks her door open whil they're moving - he SLAMS on the brakes. She jumps out --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn it, Bella --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bella hurries up the road toward her house. Jacob's suddenly standing in front of her, furious --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop.   You gotta come with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay.   They're my friends --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you get it? If a Cullen is back here, this is their territory. The Treaty says we can only defend our own lands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- It's not a war --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is. And you'll only be safe in La Push. I can't protect you here anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't need you to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- You're about to cross a line --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only if you draw one.                               She starts to move past him, but he stops her --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not letting you do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have a choice.   I don't                  belong to you.                                      Her words are a knife to the heart. She sees that, but can't take them back. He hands her the keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye, Bella, I hope you don't die. She flinches at the stinging remark. He disappears into t darkness, leaving her alone on the dark road. She's closer to her house than her truck. She hurries forward. The NIGHT SOUNDS start to encroach, branches crackling, bushes rustling. She glances behind her... nothing but darkness... she faces forward again --- And runs directly into a VAMPIRE! Bella SCREAMS -- then realizes IT'S ALICE. Bella is stunned. So is Alice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're... alive. She's clearly confused, but Bella hugs her with tears of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God, Alice.    You're here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard voices - I didn't think it was you but - you're alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You keep saying that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw you - a vision of you - you jumped off a cliff. I knew I'd be too late but --                                         (becoming angry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why the hell would you try to kill yourself?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't.    I was cliff diving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um... fun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was fun for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Until I hit the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have never met anyone more prone to life-threatening idiocy... and what is that hideous wet dog smell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Probably Jacob.      He's kind of a           werewolf. Off Alice's horrified expression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Bella makes herself hot chocolate, Alice paces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Werewolves are not vicious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Until they lose their tempers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They saved me from Laurent, they're protecting me from Victoria --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shocked)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victoria? I didn't see her. I didn't              see you get pulled from the water                 either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was Jacob who saved me. More than              once. I couldn't have made it without             him. You have no idea what it was                 like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softening)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I do. I knew leaving wouldn't                be good for you. I tried to tell Edward, but he wouldn't listen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hesitantly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Does he know you're here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.   He's been... away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dump, empty but for a table and chair. On the table lie THE PHOTOS that once lined Bella's walls. Edward stands i the center of the room, stock still, staring out at the rising sun. His face is as empty and desolate as Bella's was after he left. A CELL PHONE on the table RINGS jarringly. He doesn't mov It continues. Finally, he whips the receiver to his ear, exasperated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow, Edward finally answered the phone. I feel so honored...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rosalie, on the phone, stands at the picture window -- ROSALIE'S POV - EXT. ALASKAN HOUSE - Emmett, Jasper, Carlisle and Esme walk away from the house, over the snow the treeline, on their way to hunt. None wear coats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm hanging up now... Rosalie turns away from the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait!... You should come home.                   (no response)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Esme's a wreck, Carlisle never smiles.           Even Emmett's depressed. You've really done a number on them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pained)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I am. But they wouldn't               be happier with me around. Trust me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... I just miss... us.   The family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. But the further away I am,               the safer Bella will be. She deserves            a shot at a normal life --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But see, you don't have to worry about                that, not anymore -- She stops realizing she may be making a mistake.     But caught it, sits up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, Rose?   Did something happen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I - uh --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me, Rosalie. (rises, fierce)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me! --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (blurts)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Alice had a vision. She saw Bella -                - throw herself off a cliff... She's dead, Edward. Edward reels, uncomprehending.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... don't believe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice is there now. Thought she could                 help with the funeral or something.                   STAY ON ROSALIE as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come home, Edward. It's time...                       Edward...?                                            She's been disconnected.   Off Rosalie, worried...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bella walks Charlie to his cruiser. He wears a dark, ill- fitting funeral suit. At the car, Bella adjusts his tie -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for understanding, Bells. They                 wanted to keep the service small.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry about me.    Are you gonna                be okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... but Sue, and those kids -- Leah's only a year older than you. And Seth's, what, fourteen... Emotion threatens. She hugs him. He holds on a little too tightly for a beat. Then he bucks up, climbs into his car

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There'll be a reception after. I might stay late, see if I can help. Bella nods, then waves as he drives away. She turns to he back inside but finds Alice suddenly at her side. She jum

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not the most popular person on the werewolf rez right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (saddened)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you're friends with me.                      Bella shrugs. Alice hears something, then looks down the road -- JACOB'S RABBIT appears in the distance....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh. Didn't see them coming. Didn't                  see him pull you out of the water -                  maybe my visions are allergic to dogs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Alice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (jogging off)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll go do some hunting. ANGLE ON THE RABBIT -- as it pulls up. Jacob drives, Embr the passenger seat. Bella approaches, surprised to find Q in the back; same short hair and hard look as the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quil... you, too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (aggressive)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Me, too.                                       Jacob climbs out.   Embry takes the driver's seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You alone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.   Shouldn't you be at the funeral?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Had to talk to you first. (to the guys)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll meet you there. Go on. They're wary... but pull out.      Jacob follows Bella in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob enters behind Bella.   She turns to him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Jake, I'm sorry I --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This place stinks to hell. She sees he's shut down, cold.      She shuts down, as we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're welcome to leave.      In fact --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- How many Cullens are here and how long are they staying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (snapping back)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just Alice. And she'll stay as long as she wants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are the rest coming back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not that I'm aware of.      Anything else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better go report to Sam. Jacob turns, starts to leave. He looks back, sees her ang turn to hurt. He stops. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've done it again. I keep breaking                   my promise not to hurt you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't have to be this way. He moves back to her, looks into her eyes with sadness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I gonna lose you this time, Jacob? He can't answer that, but he presses his hand to her chee

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was easier when we were both human, wasn't it? They look at one another, Jacob's hand still on her face, his eyes searching hers. Slowly, he starts to bend toward her lips. She doesn't pu away. She misses him too much, needs him too badly. This time, she'll let it happen. A kiss is a centimeter away.. Suddenly, the shrill RING of the phone makes them both ju Jacob, the closest to it, doesn't move his face, just kee looking into her eyes as he reaches for the phone, answer

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swan residence.                                       She smiles.   But he instantly bristles, voice going cold

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not here. He's at a funeral...                   Then the phone goes dead --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Edward stares at his phone crazed, enraged, grief- stricken -- he HURLS it against the wall, shattering it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Jacob hangs up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Filthy bloodsucker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, who was it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (spitting it out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Carlisle Cullen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should have let me talk to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't ask for you --                              Suddenly, Jacob's eyes go wild, his body stiffens, starts trembling in the way that precedes a wolf-morph.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Step away from me, Bella. Bella turns to see what he's reacting to - Alice. She stands in doorway looking empty, despairing. Bella immediately hurries to her side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice, what's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Edward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about him? What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just saw him in a vision.   He...                   thinks you're dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (realizing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was him calling, not Carlisle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bella, he's going to Italy... to the                  Volturi... OFF BELLA'S FACE -- FLASHPOPS of the CIRCULAR HALL, the THREE VOLTURI - the DISMEMBERING of the rogue vampire --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door SLAMS open and Bella races in, shoving clothes i a bag. Jacob dogs her, protesting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you have to go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He won't believe Alice.    He has to see                 that I'm alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stops her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He left you, Bella. He didn't want you anymore, remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I still love him, and I'm not gonna let him kill himself out of guilt. This wounds him. But she can't stop to soothe him. pulls away and continues packing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about your dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm eighteen, legally free to go. I'll leave a note.                                       Alice enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got the airline tickets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (squaring off with Alice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You Cullens might hunt animals but those monsters in Italy don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm well aware what the Volturi are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why are you taking Bella to them like a bottle of wine to a party?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, she's better off here with Victoria stalking her. The one you dogs can't seem to catch? Jacob growls, a shudder ripping through him. Bella intercedes, stopping him from morphing by grabbing Alice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice flies to her car. But Jacob catches Bella's arm, no hostile. Just pleading.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, Bella. Stay here.   For                       Charlie... for me. Bella sees the love in his eyes; this could be last time ever sees him. She hugs him, then pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye, Jacob. He watches, agonized as she races to the car, climbs in..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bella tries to pull on her seat belt but Alice stops her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe Jacob's right.                                  (Bella tries to                                  interrupt)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. You need to realize - the Volturi                 could easily see me as Edward's accomplice. And you're a human who knows too much and tastes too good. They could kill us all. Bella's response is to yank her seat belt into its clip. Alice sees she won't change her mind. She shifts into gea and PEELS OUT. Bella looks out the window for Jacob; he's not there... she turns toward the woods -- BELLA'S POV -- THE TREELINE -- SHREDDED CLOTHING FLIES in air as we SEE the HIND LEGS OF A WOLF disappear into the forest. Off Bella, fighting tears but determined as hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON EDWARD walking down a seemingly endless corridor. Finally, he reaches a set of intricately carved double do which open for him. He enters --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Edward finds himself facing three wooden thrones, on which sit the ancient Volturi: Aro, Marcus, Caius. Aro wears an expensive, contemporary, black Italian suit, long black hair in a loose ponytail to his waist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus and Caius eschew modern clothing for rich silk rob their long hair loose around them. All three have translucent, onion-like, white skin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you decided?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was an intriguing debate.     We don't get many suicidal vampires.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pathetic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid your gifts are too valuable to destroy. But if you're unhappy with your lot, join us. We'd be delighted to utilize your skills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you won't end this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not without cause. Edward registers this, his face setting. Clearly, he's going to give them cause. He strides out. Off Aro...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Such a waste.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bella waits impatiently at the curb as -- A YELLOW HARD-TOP PORSCHE with darkly tinted windows SCREECHES to a halt in front of her. The passenger door opens - Alice is behind the wheel, pulling off the chic, white, hooded coat she used for protection against the su As Bella climbs in, buckles up --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd you get the car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hope you're not opposed to grand theft auto.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not today. Alice FLOORS it and the Porsche PEELS OUT --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AERIAL VIEW - THE YELLOW PORSCHE screams down a highway, cutting lanes, weaving through Peugots and Fiats --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bella grips the dashboard as Alice narrowly misses a car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much time do we have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's waiting till noon, when the sun's                at its highest...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's jumpy, uneven -- EDWARD stands in shadow, his shirt open, eyes shut. A clock GONGS as he steps into SUNLIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... He's going to make the Volturi                    change their minds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (checking her watch)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's almost noon now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's Volterra. Alice punches it as Bella SEES -- BELLA'S POV - A MEDIEVAL FORTIFIED VILLAGE atop a distant hill. Volterra.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The narrow, centuries-old streets are crowded with festiv revellers who all wear RED. They gaily head toward the to square carrying red pendants, balloons, scarves. The PORSCHE weaves through them, hurrying forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are they all wearing red?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: San Marcos Day festival. The perfect                setting. Large crowds. The Volturi                  won't let him get far enough to reveal              himself - he's counting on that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We only have five minutes -- Alice screeches to a halt at a ROAD BLOCK.   Italian POLI wave her back. Bella jumps out --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the square?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Follow that lane -- -- Bella's already running --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll be under the clock tower! Alice watches her go... then senses something, looks up -

dialogues.speaker: ON THE ROOFTOPS
dialogues.text: OVERCOAT leaps from building to building, tracking Bella. As he disappears, off Alice --

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Bella races down the cobble-stoned alleys, stumbling on t uneven stones. Festival revellers head in the same direction, she maneuvers around them. ABOVE BELLA - SEE flashes of the FIGURE IN THE OVERCOAT - As Bella nears the square, the alleys become more populat She pushes past people AD LIBBING "excuse me," "sorry." Finally, she emerges into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BELLA'S POV - a sea of scarlet flags, dresses and jackets On the other side of the crowded square - THE CLOCK TOWER it reads one minute before noon. Bella battles her way through the square; the crowd shove back, shouting at her in Italian --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fare attenzione!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bella charges forward to find herself blocked by -- A FOUNTAIN - Suddenly, GONG!    The clock tower bells chi It's noon! Bella jumps into the fountain, wades through the shallow water to the other side -- she jumps out and barrels thro the crowd. Finally, she SEES --

dialogues.speaker: BENEATH THE CLOCK TOWER
dialogues.text: Edward, in the shadows, just inches from the sunlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward! -- -- GONG! Bella's cry is drowned out by the BOOMING CHIME. She pushes toward him, fighting to reach him as -- CLOSE ON EDWARD (IN SLOW MOTION) - as he unbuttons his shirt, exposing his bare chest -- ON BELLA (IN SLOW MOTION) - calling his name -- ON EDWARD'S FACE - he closes his eyes, welcoming death -- then slowly -- Edward takes a step into the sunlight, the rays hitting h shoe, but before the sun touches his skin -- BELLA SLAMS into him - it's like running into a brick wal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Edward!    Don't! Edward opens his eyes and looks at Bella as the clock boo its final CHIME. He's amazed, already dead in his mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carlisle was right... heaven...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm here. I'm alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're... not real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at me!    Alice was wrong.                       He begins to realize... she is real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bella?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, step back.   I'm alive, I'm -- He suddenly kisses her, stepping back into the shade with her. They soak each other in like starved people suddenly nourished. He pulls away to look at her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here. They share a long look, he's about to kiss her again... w suddenly, he stiffens -- and abruptly PUSHES Bella behind him, taking a protective stance in front of her -- They face the DARK ALLEY that runs under the clock tower. Out of the alley's shadows emerge -- TWO FIGURES IN HOODED OVERCOATS. Both stunningly handsome males in their 20's: FELIX, huge, strong; and DEMETRI, slender, elegant. Both have unsettling burgundy red EYES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't be needing your services after all, gentlemen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aro wants to speak with you again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No rules were broken.                                 Demetri's smile suggests he doesn't agree. He's the more gracious of the two. But no less dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should take this conversation to a more appropriate venue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. Bella, why don't you stay and                   enjoy the festival?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girl comes with us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not going to happen --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALICE suddenly appears, lightly tripping through the alle toward them, pulling back the hood of her white swing coa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, guys, it's a festival.                     She reaches Edward and Bella, positioning herself in a protective stance, as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We wouldn't want to make a scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There won't be any scene.    And we'll              still win.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But not easily --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough. A very tiny, young woman appears, JANE. She also wears a dark overcoat, her Botticelli angel-like face peering out from under the hood. SEE her CRIMSON IRISES. Felix and Demetri are back off immediately. Edward and Alice step back, as well. Bella can see they're afraid of this small girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding to her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto to Alice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto to Bella)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just do as she says. Jane tosses Edward an overcoat.    He dons it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Follow me. Jane simply turns and heads up the alley, confident they' follow. Felix, smirking, gestures for them to go ahead of him. Edward takes Bella's hand...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane leads Edward, Bella and Alice through several narrow dark alleys. Felix and Demetri bring up the rear. Edward never loosens his grip on Bella's hand. Their path dead ends at a WALL OF BRICK. Jane just stride forward and, without breaking pace - drops down into an O HOLE in the street; it's a drain. Alice follows Jane. Bella looks down, sees nothing but BLACKNESS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's alright. Alice will catch you. Edward takes her wrists, dangles her over the hole --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- ON BELLA as she drops through the darkness, to be caug by Alice. Edward lands beside them, then Felix and Demetr Edward pulls Bella close as they follow Jane through the sewer. He meets Bella's eyes, trying to look reassuring, but he's tense as hell. Finally, they reach -- A FOLDING IRON ELEVATOR DOOR. Jane easily pulls it aside. They all enter. As the door CLANGS shut on them --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON MODERN ELEVATOR DOORS OPENING. They all exit int

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An elegantly decorated space with old world charm. They'r greeted politely by GIANNA an attractive (human) receptio

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buon pomeriggio. They head through the lobby to -- THE LONG CORRIDOR that Edward traversed earlier.   Finall they reach the carved double doors which open --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bella, Edward and Alice enter to face the three ancients: Aro, Marcus, Caius. Eight VOLTURI GUARDS (including Jane, Felix, Demetri) lin walls in a variety of modern dark overcoats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BELLA'S POV - THE FLOOR - there's a depression in the cen that leads to a drain. Bella shivers. Aro rises, greets them like old friends, taking Edward's hand and shaking it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a happy surprise! Bella is alive after all. Isn't that wonderful? Caius responds with a sour expression. Marcus could care less. Aro doesn't release Edward's hand, looks at him as

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her blood appeals to you so much it makes me thirsty. How can you stand to be so close to her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
